result.execSummary:
The defendant Rayshaun L. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with felons, any of the victims, not to be w/n 1500 feet of victims residences, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Amended Assmt Report
Joint & Several Restitution

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  DE appeared (by phone from Danville Correctional Institution in Illinois) without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  DE stipulates to and court orders restitution of $955.31 jointly and severally with Marquis Jones 14CF730 and Everett Robinson 14CF732.
With Alexis/Danville Correctional Center a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the TC on 10/12/17 at 1:45pm.
Telephone conference on October 12, 2017 at 01:45 pm. (Only sent to deft and ADA McNeill)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 12 years WSP consecutive to Lake County case 14CF1806; 8 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $400 extradition costs and $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact w/felons, any of the victims, not to be within 1500 feet of victims residence.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B. Ekes.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Ekes received the PSI late and has not had time to review it with the deft.  Court finds good cause to adjourn sentencing to 6/27/16 @ 2:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.  SEH 6/6/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Ekes the case is set for a PLEAH on 4/1/16 at 8:15am; the JS of 4/4/16 at 8:30am is cancelled.

and  Demand for Discovery

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Brett Eckes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Co-defendant case is going to trial on 4/4/16.  This case remains on for trial on the same day.  Bond continued.,

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ekes states he is waiting for an offer from the State.  ADA McNeill requests that detainer time limits be extended until time of trial.  Atty Ekes not does not object to extension of detainer.  Deft waives right to time limits on detainer.  JSH set for 2/1/16 at 1:15pm and JS 4/4/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Rayshaun L. Jones appeared with Attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:45 am.

*No Contact w/ Everett D J, Marquis X. J, Timothy  & Aimee K, their residences.
